been looking at creating a configurable test suite and test

You might want to ta=
ke a look at JxUnit at 
http://sourceforge.net/projects/jxunit/ or 
http://=
quickutil.sourceforge.net/view/Main/JXUnit where it says:

JXUnit is a dire=
ctory-driven test scripting which builds on JUnit and JXQuick.
Test data pl=
ays a central role in testing. From the lowest level (method 
tests) to the=
 highest (acceptance tests), a test involves input data, 
expected output d=
ata, and a comparison between the expected and actual 
output data.
JXUnit =
separates test data from test code. This has several advantages:
=B7       =
Test data can be edited, making it easy to add additional test cases;
=B7  =
     Test data can be validated, as a means of reducing "false 
failures"; =
and
=B7       Test data can be externally generated or captured from a prod=
uction 
process.

Robert
